lines.gurmukhi: 1 lylw mjnUM Awd pRymI
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: lylY mjnUM AwskI chu ckI jwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Lailay Majanoon Aasakee Chahu Chakee Jaatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The lovers Lana and Majanu are well known in all the quarters of the world.

lines.gurmukhi: soriT bIjw gwvIAY jsu suGVw vwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Soratdi Beejaa Gaaveeai Jasu Sougharhaa Vaatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The excellent song of Sorath and Bija is sung in every direction.

lines.gurmukhi: ssI puMnUM dosqI huie jwiq AjwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Sasee Pounnoon Dosatee Hui Jaati Ajaatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The love of Sassi and Punn√º, though of different castes, is everywhere spoken of.

lines.gurmukhi: myhIvwl no sohxI nY qrdI rwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Mayheevaal No Sohanee Nai Taradee Raatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fame of Sohni who used to swim the Chenab river in the ht to meet Mahival is well known.

lines.gurmukhi: rwNJw hIr vKwxIAY Ehu iprm prwqI
lines.transliteration_english: Raanjhaa Heer Vakhaaneeai Aohu Piram Paraatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ranjha and Hir are renowned for the love they bore each other.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdw iprhVI gwvin prBwqI ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Gaavani Parabhaatee ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: But superior to all is the love the disciples bear their Guru.They sing it at the ambrosial hour of morning.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 murIdwN dI pRIiq

Shabad OS B.translation: Love of the disciples

lines.gurmukhi: AmlI Amlu n CfnI huie bhin iekTy
lines.transliteration_english: Amalee Amalu N Chhadanee Hui Bahani Ikatday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Opium-eaters eschew not opium and sit down together to eat it.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau jUey jUAwrIAw lig dwv aupTy
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Jooay Jooaareeaa Lagi Daav Oupatday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gamblers indulge in play and lose their stakes.

lines.gurmukhi: corI cor n plrih duK shin grTy
lines.transliteration_english: Choree Chor N Palarahi Doukh Sahani Garatday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thieves do not abandon thieving and suffer punishment when caught.

lines.gurmukhi: rhin n gixkw vwiVAhu vykrmI lTy
lines.transliteration_english: Rahani N Ganikaa Vaarhiahu Vaykaramee Latday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The evil-doers do not remain away from the house of the ill-repute women though they sell off even their clothes to provide for them.

lines.gurmukhi: pwpI pwpu kmwvdy hoie iPrdy nTy
lines.transliteration_english: Paapee Paapu Kamaavaday Hoi Dhiraday Natday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sinners commit sin anu abscond to avoid punishment.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdw iprhVI sB pwp pxTy ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Sabh Paap Panatday ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: But, contrary to all these, the Sikhs of the Guru, (whose companionship is far from being injurious) love their Guru, and he absolves them of all their sins.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 murIdwN dI pRIiq

Shabad OS B.translation: Love of the disciples

lines.gurmukhi: BvrY vwsu ivxwsu hY iPrdw PulvwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhavarai Vaasu Vinaasu Hai Dhiradaa Phulavaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The black bee gets perished while enjoying the fragrance in the garden.

lines.gurmukhi: jlY pqMgu insMgu hoie kir AiK auGwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Jalai Patangu Nisangu Hoi Kari Akhi Oughaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Moth fearlessly burns itself on the flame but goes on beholding in the face of the flame up to last.

lines.gurmukhi: imrg nwid ibsmwdu hoie iPrdw EjwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Mirag Naadi Bisamaadu Hoi Dhiradaa Ujaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Overwhelmed by melody, the deer goes on wandering in the forests.

lines.gurmukhi: kuMfI PwQy mC ijau ris jIB ivgwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Koundee Dhaaday Machh Jiu Rasi Jeebh Vigaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Overpowered by the taste of tongue, the fish itself catches the hook.

lines.gurmukhi: hwQix hwQI PwihAw duK shY idhwVI
lines.transliteration_english: Haadani Haadee Dhaahiaa Doukh Sahai Dihaarhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Out of lust for its female, the male elephant gets caught and bears sufferings for the rest of life.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdw iprhVI lwie inj Gir qwVI ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Laai Nij Ghari Taarhee ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, the Sikhs of the Guru love their Guru and stablize themselves in their true selves.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 gur isK pRIiq

Shabad OS B.translation: Love of a Gursikh

lines.gurmukhi: cMd ckor prIq hY lwie qwr inhwly
lines.transliteration_english: Chand Chakor Pareet Hai Laai Taar Nihaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Red-legged partridge (chakor) loves moon and hence stares at it without even losing its glance.

lines.gurmukhi: ckvI sUrj hyq hY imil hoin suKwly
lines.transliteration_english: Chakavee Sooraj Hayt Hai Mili Honi Soukhaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ruddy sheldrake (chakavi) loves sun, and in sunlight, meeting its beloved feels elated.

lines.gurmukhi: nyhu kvl jl jwxIAY iKiV muh vyKwly
lines.transliteration_english: Nayhu Kaval Jal Jaaneeai Khirhi Muh Vaykhaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lotus loves water and shows the water its blossomed face.

lines.gurmukhi: mor bbIhy boldy vyiK bdl kwly
lines.transliteration_english: Mor Babeehay Boladay Vaykhi Badal Kaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rain birds and peacocks also shriek when they see the clouds.

lines.gurmukhi: nwir Bqwr ipAwru hY mwN puq smHwly
lines.transliteration_english: Naari Bhataar Piaaru Hai Maan Pout Samhaalay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wife loves her husband and mother takes care of the son.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdw iprhVI Ehu inbhY nwly ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaa Piraharhee Aohu Nibahai Naalay ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly the Sikh loves Guru and this love accompanies him to the end.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 pIr murId dI pRIq

Shabad OS B.translation: Love between Sikh and the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: rUpY kwmY dosqI jg AMdir jwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Roopai Kaamai Dosatee Jag Andari Jaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Friendship of beauty and lust is known all over the world.

lines.gurmukhi: BuKY swdY gMFu hY Ehu ivrqI hwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhoukhai Saadai Ganddhu Hai Aohu Viratee Haanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: And this is very practical that hunger and taste are complementry.

lines.gurmukhi: Guil imil imcil lib mwil iequ Brm BulwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Ghuli Mili Michali Labi Maali Itu Bharami Bhulaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Greed and wealth also mix up with each other and remain deluded.

lines.gurmukhi: aUGY sauiV plMG ijau siB rYix ivhwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Oughai Saurhi Palagh Jiu Sabhi Raini Vihaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: For a dozing person, even a small cot is a pleasure to pass the night.

lines.gurmukhi: suhxy sB rMg mwxIAin kir coj ivfwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Suhanay Sabh Rang Maaneeani Kari Choj Vidaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the dream, one enjoys every colour of events.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI Ehu AkQ khwxI ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Aohu Akad Kahaanee ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise, indescribable is the story of the love of the Sikh and the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: 6 pIr murId dI pRIq

Shabad OS B.translation: Love between Sikh and the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: mwn srovru hMslw Kwie mwxk moqI
lines.transliteration_english: Maan Sarovar Hansalaa Khaai Maanak Motee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The swan of Mansarovar picks up only pearls and jewels.

lines.gurmukhi: koiel AMb prIiq hY iml bol sroqI
lines.transliteration_english: Koil Anb Pareeti Hai Mil Bol Sarotee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The nightingale and mango tree bear love for each other, and hence it sings thereupon.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn vwsu vxwsupiq hoie pws KloqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Vaasu Vanaasoupati Hoi Paas Khalotee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sandal loves whole vegetation, and whosoever is near it, becomes fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: lohw pwris ByitAY hoie kMcn joqI
lines.transliteration_english: Lohaa Paarasi Bhaytiai Hoi Kanchan Jotee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Touching the philosopher's stone the iron brightens like gold.

lines.gurmukhi: ndIAw nwly gMg imil hoin Coq ACoqI
lines.transliteration_english: Nadeeaa Naalay Gang Mili Honi Chhot Achhotee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even the defiled streams, meeting the Ganges, become sacred.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI ieh Kyp sEqI ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Ih Khayp Saaotee ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such is also the love between the Sikh and the Guru, and to a Sikh, this is most priceless commodity.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 s`cw swk

Shabad OS B.translation: True relationship

lines.gurmukhi: swhuru pIhru pK qRY Gru nwnyhwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Saahuru Peeharu Pakh Trai Gharu Naanayhaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: There are three types of relationship - first those of father, mother, sister, brother and their offspring and alliances;

lines.gurmukhi: shurw ssu vKwxIAY swlI qY swlw
lines.transliteration_english: Sahuraa Sasu Vakhaaneeai Saalee Tai Saalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Second, mother's father, mother's mother, mother's sisters, mother's brothers;

lines.gurmukhi: mw ipau BYxwN Bwierw prvwru durwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Maa Piu Bhainaa Bhaairaa Paravaaru Duraalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Third, father-in-law, mother-in-law, brother-in-law, and sister-in-law.

lines.gurmukhi: nwnw nwnI mwsIAwN mwmy jMjwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Naanaa Naanee Maaseeaa Maamay Janjaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: For them, gold, silver, diamonds, and corals are amassed.

lines.gurmukhi: suienw rupw sMjIAY hIrw prvwlw
lines.transliteration_english: Suinaa Roupaa Sanjeeai Heeraa Paravaalaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: But dearer than all is the love of the Guru's Sikhs for the Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI eyhu swku suKwlw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Ayhu Saaku Soukhaalaa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: And, this is the relationship which brings happiness.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 s`cw kMm

Shabad OS B.translation: The true business

lines.gurmukhi: vxju krY vwpwrIAw iqqu lwhw qotw
lines.transliteration_english: Vanaju Karai Vaapaareeaa Titu Laahaa Totaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The trader trades and he earns profits as well as loss.

lines.gurmukhi: ikrswxI ikrswxu kir hoie dublw motw
lines.transliteration_english: Kirasaanee Kirasaanu Kari Hoi Doubalaa Motaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The farmer cultivates and thus increases or decreases.

lines.gurmukhi: cwkru lgY cwkrI rix KwNdw cotwN
lines.transliteration_english: Chaakaru Lagai Chaakaree Rani Khaandaa Chotaan.

Shabad OS B.translation: The servant serves and gets blows in the battlefield.

lines.gurmukhi: rwju jogu sMswru ivic vx KMf gV kotw
lines.transliteration_english: Raaju Jogu Sansaaru Vichi Van Khand Garh Kotaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The results of ruling, living as a yogi, residing in the world, forest

lines.gurmukhi: AMiq kwil jmjwlu pY pwey Pl Potw
lines.transliteration_english: Anti Kaali Jam Jaalu Pai Paaay Phal Dhotaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And forts are such that ultimately man is caught in the web of yama i.e. he goes on transmigrating.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI huie kdy nw qotw ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Hui Kaday N Totaa ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: But such is love between the Sikh and his Guru that loss is never suffered.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 s`cw Bog

Shabad OS B.translation: True enjoyment

lines.gurmukhi: AKI vyiK n rjIAw bhu rMg qmwsy
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Vaykhi N Rajeeaa Bahu Rang Tamaasay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The eyes are not satisfied with beholding sights and exhibitions;

lines.gurmukhi: ausqiq inMdw kMin suix rovix qY hwsy
lines.transliteration_english: Ousatati Nidaa Kanni Souni Rovani Tai Haasay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The ears are not satisfied with hearing praise or blame, mourning or rejoicing;

lines.gurmukhi: swdIN jIB n rjIAw kir Bog iblwsy
lines.transliteration_english: Saadeen Jeebh N Rajeeaa Kari Bhog Bilaasay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tongue is not satisfied with eating what affords pleasure and delight;

lines.gurmukhi: nk n rjw vwsu lY durgMD suvwsy
lines.transliteration_english: Nak N Rajaa Vaasu Lai Duragandh Suvaasay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The nose is not contented with good or evil odour;

lines.gurmukhi: rij n koeI jIivAw kUVy Brvwsy
lines.transliteration_english: Raji N Koee Jeeviaa Koorhay Bharavaasay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nobody is satisfied with his span of life, and everyone entertains false hopes.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI scI rhrwsy ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Sachee Raharaasay ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: But the Sikhs are satisfied with the Guru and theirs is the true love and delight.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 s`cI AMg sPlqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Worth of the limbs

lines.gurmukhi: DiRgu isru jo gur nw invY gur lgY n crxI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhrigu Siru Jo Gur N Nivai Gur Lagai N Charanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cursed is the head that bows not before the Guru and touches not his feet.

lines.gurmukhi: DiRgu loieix gur drs ivxu vyKY pr qrxI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhrigu Loini Gur Daras Vinu Vaykhai Par Taranee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cursed are the eyes who instead of beholding the Guru behold another's wife.

lines.gurmukhi: DiRg srvix aupdys ivxu suix suriq n DrxI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhrig Saravani Oupadays Vinu Souni Surati N Dharanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those ears are (also) cursed which do not listen to the sermon of the Guru and do not concentrate upon it'

lines.gurmukhi: DiRgu ijhbw gur sbd ivxu hor mMqR ismrxI
lines.transliteration_english: Dhrigu Jihabaa Gur Sabad Vinu Hor Mantr Simaranee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cursed is that tongue which recites ‚Ä¢ mantras other than the word of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu syvw DiRgu hQ pYr hor inhPl krxI
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Sayvaa Dhrigu Had Pair Hor Nihaphal Karanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Without service, cursed are the heads, and feet, and useless are other deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI suK siqgur srxI ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Soukh Satigur Saranee ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: The (true) love is there between the Sikh and the Guru and the real delight is there in the shelter of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 s`cI lgn

Shabad OS B.translation: The true devotion

lines.gurmukhi: horqu rMig n rcIAY sBu kUV idsMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Horatu Rangi N Racheeai Sabhu Koorhu Disandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Love none but the Guru; all other love is false.

lines.gurmukhi: horqu swid n lgIAY hoie ivsul gMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Horatu Saadi N Lageeai Hoi Visu Lagandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Enjoy no other relish than his, for it would be poisonous.

lines.gurmukhi: horqu rwg n rIJIAY suix suK n lhMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Horatu Raag N Reejheeai Souni Soukh N Lahandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Be not pleased with any one else's singing, for listening to it would bring no happiness.

lines.gurmukhi: horu burI krqUiq hY lgY Plu mMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Horu Buree Karatooti Hai Lagai Phalu Mandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All acts not in conformity with the Guru's teaching, are evil, and bear evil fruit.

lines.gurmukhi: horqu pMiQ n clIAY Tgu coru muhMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Horatu Panthi N Chaleeai Tdagu Choru Muhandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Walk only in the way of true Guru, because in all other ways, there are thieves who cheat and rob.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI scu sic imlMdw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Sachu Sachi Miladaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: The love of the Guru's Sikhs for the Guru causes their soul to blend their truth with the Truth.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 s`cI lgn

Shabad OS B.translation: The true devotion

lines.gurmukhi: dUjI Aws ivxwsu hY pUrI ikau hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Doojee Aas Vinaasu Hai Pooree Kiu Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Other hopes (except Lord's) are ruination; how could they be accomplished.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw moh su DRoh sBu Ehu AMiq ivgovY
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Moh Su Dhroh Sabhu Aohu Anti Vigovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Other infatuations are delusion which ultimately lead (man) astray.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw krmu suBrm hY kir Avgux rovY
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Karamu Soubharam Hai Kari Avagoun Rovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Other actions are deceits by which man cultivates demerits and suffers.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw sMgu kuFMgu hY ikau BirAw DovY
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Sangu Kuddhangu Hai Kiu Bhariaa Dhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The company of the sense of otherness is a perfidious way of living; and how it could wash away the sinful life.

lines.gurmukhi: dUjw Bwau kudwau hY hwir jnmu KlovY
lines.transliteration_english: Doojaa Bhaau Kudaau Hai Haari Janamu Khalovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The othemness is a wrong stake which ultimatley makes one lose the (battle of) life.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI gux guxI provY ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Goun Gounee Parovai ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: The love between the Sikhs and the Guru, brings the meritorious people closer and makes them one (sangat).

lines.gurmukhi: 13 gurU jI dI pRIq dw rUp

Shabad OS B.translation: The nature of the love of Guru

lines.gurmukhi: AimE idsit kir kCu vwNig Bvjl ivic rKY
lines.transliteration_english: Amiao Disati Kari Kachhu Vaangi Bhavajal Vichi Rakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the contraction of limbs saves the tortoise, the ambrosial vision of the Guru saves the Sikh from the world ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwn AMs dy hMs vwNig buiJ BK ABKY
lines.transliteration_english: Giaan Ans Day Hans Vaangi Bujhi Bhakh Abhakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like a swan having discriminatory knowledge (of sifting water from milk), this vision of Guru provides wisdom about the edible and the inedible.

lines.gurmukhi: ismrx krdy kUMj vwNig auif lKY AlKY
lines.transliteration_english: Simaran Karaday Koonj Vaangi Udi Lakhai Alakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like a Siberian crane which keeps in mind its off-springs, the Guru also always takes care of the disciples, and (through his spiritual powers) foresees the invisible.

lines.gurmukhi: mwqw bwlk hyqu kir Ehu swau n cKY
lines.transliteration_english: Maataa Baalak Haytu Kari Aohu Saau N Chakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the mother shares not the pleasures of her son, the Guru also has no demand of the Sikh.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur purKu dieAwlu hY gurisK prKY
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Purakhu Daiaalu Hai Gurasikh Parakhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is kind and (sometime) tests also the Sikhs.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI lK mulIAin kKY ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Lakh Muleeani Kakhai ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: The love between the Guru and the Sikh makes the latter valuable like a blade of grass made worthy of million (coins)

lines.gurmukhi: 14 gurU nwl pRIq dw rUp

Shabad OS B.translation: Nature of the Love of Sikh with Guru

lines.gurmukhi: drsnu dyiK pqMg ijau joqI joiq smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Darasanu Daykhi Patang Jiu Jotee Joti Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Beholding the flame (of the lamp), as the moth mingles with the flame and

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv imrg ijau Anhd ilv lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Mirag Jiu Anahad Liv Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Deer absorbs its consciousness in the melodious Word, likewise in the river of holy congregation,

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ivic mInu hoie gurmiq suK pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Vichi Meenu Hoi Guramati Soukh Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh becoming fish and adopting the way of the wisdom of the Guru, enjoys the life.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl iciq Bvru hoie suK rYix ivhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Vichi Bhavaru Hoi Soukh Raini Vihaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: By becoming black bee of the lotus feet (of the Lord), the Sikh spends his night ecstatically.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdysu n ivsrY bwbIhw iDAwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadays N Visarai Baabeehaa Dhiaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He never forgets the teaching of the Guru and repeats it as the rainbird does in the rainy season.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI duibDw nw suKwvY ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Doubidhaa Naa Soukhaavai ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: The love between the Guru and the disciple is such that they do not like the sense of duality.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 gurU srb qoN smr`Q hY

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru is all powerful

lines.gurmukhi: dwqw Ehu n mMgIAY iPir mMgix jweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Daataa Aohu N Mangeeai Dhiri Mangani Jaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ask not for a giver from whom you shall have to appeal to another

lines.gurmukhi: hoCw swhu n kIceI iPir pCoqweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Hochhaa Saahu N Keechaee Dhiri Pachhotaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Employ not a brusque banker who will afterwords make you repent.

lines.gurmukhi: swihbu Ehu n syvIAY jm fMfu shweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Saahibu Aohu N Sayveeai Jam Dandu Sahaaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Serve not such a master as will render you liable to death's punishment.

lines.gurmukhi: haumY rogu n kteI Ehu vYdu n lweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Rogu N Kataee Aohu Vaidu N Laaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Engage not a physician who cannot cure the malady of pride.

lines.gurmukhi: durmiq mYlu n auqrY ikauN qIriQ nweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Duramati Mailu N Outarai Kiu Teeradi Naaeeai.

Shabad OS B.translation: What is the use of bathing the body at the places of pilgrimages if the filth of evil inclinations is not cleansed.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI suK shij smweIAY
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Soukh Sahaji Samaaeeai ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: The love between the Guru and the disciples brings happiness and composure.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 gurU pRIq sB qoN au`cI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Highest is the love for Guru

lines.gurmukhi: mwlu mulku cqurMg dl dunIAw piqswhI
lines.transliteration_english: Maalu Mulaku Chaturang Dal Douneeaa Patisaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If being master of army having four divisions (elephant, chariot, horse and infantry), country and the wealth;

lines.gurmukhi: iriD isiD iniD bhu krwmwiq sB Klk aumwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Bahu Karaamaati Sabh Khalak Oumaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If having attraction for others due to possession of miracles through ridhis and siddhis;

lines.gurmukhi: icru jIvxu bhu hMFxwN gux igAwn augwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Chiru Jeevanu Bahu Handdhanaa Goun Giaan Ougaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: If living a long life full of qualities and knowledge

lines.gurmukhi: horsu iksY n jwxeI iciq byprvwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Horasu Kisai N Jaanaee Chiti Bayparavaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: And if being enough powerful to care for nobody is still engrossed in dilemma,

lines.gurmukhi: drgh FoeI nw lhY duibDw bdrwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Daragah Ddhoee N Lahai Doubidhaa Badaraahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He cannot have shelter in the court of Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI prvwxu su GwhI ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Paravaanu Su Ghaahee ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Due to love for his Guru, even an ordinary grass cutter Sikh becomes acceptable.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 gurU nwl dw rUp, pRIq

Shabad OS B.translation: Everything futile except love for the Guru   ,

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu guru horu iDAwnu hY sB dUjw Bwau
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Guru Horu Dhiaanu Hai Sabh Doojaa Bhaau.

Shabad OS B.translation: The concentration except on Guru is all duality.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu gur sbd igAwnu hY iPkw Awlwau
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Sabad Giaanu Hai Dhikaa Aalaau.

Shabad OS B.translation: The knowledge except theknowledge of the Guru-word is a cry in vain.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu gur crxw pUjxw sBu kUVw suAwau
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Charanaan Poojanaa Sabhu Koorhaa Suaau.

Shabad OS B.translation: Worship except the Guru feet is all false and selfishness.

lines.gurmukhi: ivxu guru bcnu ju mMnxw aUrw prQwau
lines.transliteration_english: Vinu Gur Bachanu Ju Mannanaa Ooraa Paradaau.

Shabad OS B.translation: Except the acceptance of the teaching of the Guru, all other means are incomplete.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ivxu sMgu hY sBu kcw cwau
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Vinu Sangu Hai Sabhu Kachaa Chaau.

Shabad OS B.translation: Except the meeting in the holy congregation, all other assemblages are fragile.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI ijix jwxin dwau ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Jini Jaanani Daau ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs loving their Guru, know well to win the game (of life).

lines.gurmukhi: 18 gurU pRIq hauN qoVdI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Love for the Guru decimates ego

lines.gurmukhi: lK isAwxp suriq lK lK gux cqurweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Siaanap Surati Lakh Lakh Goun Chaturaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: One may have millions of wisdoms, consciousness, qualities, meditations, honours, japs,

lines.gurmukhi: lK miq buiD suiD igAwn iDAwn lKpiq vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Mati Budhi Sudhi Giaan Dhiaan Lakh Pati Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Penances, continences, bathings on pilgrimage centres, karmas, dharmas yogas,

lines.gurmukhi: lK jp qp lK sMjmw lK qIrQ nHweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Jap Tap Lakh Sanjamaan Lakh Teerad Nhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Enjoyments rind recitations of holy scriptures to his credit.

lines.gurmukhi: krm Drm lK jog Bog lK pwT pVHweI
lines.transliteration_english: Karam Dharam Lakh Jog Bhog Lakh Paatd Parhhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: But still, if such a person controlled by ego wishes to be noticed by others,

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gxwie ivgucxw Ehu Qwie n pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Ganaai Vigouchanaa Aohu Daai N Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He has gone astray and cannot fathom the Lord (and His creation).

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI hoie Awpu gvweI ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Hoi Aapu Gavaaee ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: If the love prevails between the Guru and the disciple, the sense of ego vanishes (in the thin air).

lines.gurmukhi: 19 murId dI syvw dw rUp

Shabad OS B.translation: Nature of service by the disciples

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie Cif mxI mnUrI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Chhadi Manee Manooree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of the Guru, falling at the feet (of Guru) forswears his ego and desires of mind.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI pKw pIhxw inq krY mjUrI
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Pakhaa Peehanaa Nit Karai Majooree.

Shabad OS B.translation: He fetches water, fans the congregation, grinds flour (for latigar) and does all manual jobs.

lines.gurmukhi: qRpV JwiV ivCwieMdw cuil Joik n JUrI
lines.transliteration_english: Traparh Jhaarhi Vichhaaindaa Chuli Jhoki N Jhooree.

Shabad OS B.translation: He cleanses and spreads the sheets and gets not dejected while putting fire in the hearth.

lines.gurmukhi: murdy vwNig murIdu hoie kir isdk sbUrI
lines.transliteration_english: Muraday Vaangi Mureedu Hoi Kari Sidak Sabooree.

Shabad OS B.translation: He adopts the contentment like a dead person does.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdnu hovY isMmlhu Plu vwsu hjUrI
lines.transliteration_english: Chandanu Hovai Sinmalahu Phalu Vaasu Hajooree.

Shabad OS B.translation: He gets such a fruit of living near the Guru, as the silk-cotton tree gets by being near the sandal tree i.e. it also becomes fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI gurmuiK miq pUrI ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Guramoukhi Mati Pooree ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs loving the Guru make their wisdom complete.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 gur syvw Pl

Shabad OS B.translation: Fruit of Guru-service

lines.gurmukhi: gur syvw dw Plu Gxw ikin kImiq hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sayvaa Daa Phalu Ghanaa Kini Keemati Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Immense is the fruit of the service to the Guru; who can understand its worth.

lines.gurmukhi: rMg surMgu Acrju hY vyKwlY soeI
lines.transliteration_english: Rangu Surangu Acharaju Hai Vaykhaalay Soee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From among the wondrous shades (of life) it makes one see the most wonderful one.

lines.gurmukhi: swdu vfw ivsmwdu hY rsu guMgy goeI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadu Vadaa Visamaadu Hai Rasu Goungay Goee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The taste of the service is as awesome as the sweet is to the dumb person.

lines.gurmukhi: auqBuj vwsu invwsu hY kir clqu smoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Outabhuj Vaasu Nivaasu Hai Kari Chalatu Samoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is a great feat (of God) that the fragrance is there in the trees.

lines.gurmukhi: qolu Aqolu Amolu hY jrY Ajru koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Tolu Atolu Amolu Hai Jarai Ajaru Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The service is invaluable and incomparable; any rare endures this unendurable faculty.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI jwxY jwxoeI ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Jaanai Jaanoee ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only God, the omniscient knows the mystery of the service.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 murId qdrUp ik`kUM huMdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: How disciple becomes one with Guru    ?

lines.gurmukhi: cMnxu hovY cMnxhu ko cilq n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Channanu Hovai Channanahu Ko Chalitu N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: None knows the mystery how in the association of sandal, other trees transform into sandal.

lines.gurmukhi: dIvw bldw dIivAhuM smsir prvwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Deevaa Baladaa Deeviahoun Samasari Paravaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: From lamp is illumined the lamp and looks identical.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI rldw pwxIAY iqsu ko n is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Raladaa Paaneeai Tisu Ko N Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: No one can identify that water which mixes into water.

lines.gurmukhi: BiRMgI hovY kIiVAhu ikv AwiK vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhringee Hovai Keerhiahu Kiv Aakhi Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The small aunt turns into bhringiinsect; none can tell about it.

lines.gurmukhi: spu CufMdw kuMj no kir coj ivfwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sapu Chhudandaa Kounj No Kari Choj Vidaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The snake leaves its slough and this is again a wonderful feat.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI hYrwxu hYrwxY ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Hairaanu Hairaanai ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the love between the Guru and disciple is wondrous.

lines.gurmukhi: 22 Awqm pRwpqI jugq

Shabad OS B.translation: Technique of self realization

lines.gurmukhi: PulI vwsu invwsu hY ikqu jugiq smwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Phulee Vaasu Nivaasu Hai Kitu Jougati Samaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fragrance resides in the flowers but none knows how it takes place there.

lines.gurmukhi: Plw AMdir ijau swdu bhu isMjy iek pwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Phulaan Andari Jiu Saadu Bahu Sinjay Ik Paanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Tastes of the fruits are varied, though the same water irrigates them.

lines.gurmukhi: iGau duD ivic vKwxIAY ko mrmu n jwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Ghiu Dudhu Vichi Vakhaaneeai Ko Maramu N Jaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Butter remains in the milk but none understands this mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau bYsMqru kwT ivic Ehu AlK ivfwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Baisantaru Kaatd Vichi Aohu Alakh Vidaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the gurmukhs, due to their discipline the realization of authentic self takes place.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK sMjim inklY prgtu prvwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sanjami Nikalai Paragatu Paravaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: For this all, the gurmukh applies the method of love for Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdwN iprhVI sMgiq gurbwxI ]22]
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedaan Piraharhee Sangati Gurabaanee ?22?

Shabad OS B.translation: Sangati and the hyms of the Guru, Gurbani

lines.gurmukhi: 23 isru dIjY kwx n kIjY

Shabad OS B.translation: Never hesitate in sacrifice

lines.gurmukhi: dIpk jlY pqMg vMsu iPir dyiK n htY
lines.transliteration_english: Deepak Jalai Patang Vansu Dhiri Daykh N Hatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing the burning flame of the lamp the moths cannot withhold themselves.

lines.gurmukhi: jl ivchu PiV kFIAY mC nyhu n GtY
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Vichahu Dharhi Kaddheeai Machh Nayhu N Ghatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fish is taken out of water but still it does not give up its love for water.

lines.gurmukhi: GMfw hyVY imrg ijau suix nwdu pltY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghandaa Hayrhai Mirag Jiu Souni Naad Palatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As listening to the drum beat of the hunter, the deer turns towards the sound,

lines.gurmukhi: BvrY vwsu ivxwsu hY PiV kvlu sMGtY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhavarai Vaasu Vinaasu Hai Dharhi Kavalu Sanghatai.

Shabad OS B.translation: And the black bee by entering the flower perishes itself for enjoying the fragrance.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rsu bhu bMDn ktY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Bahu Bandhan Katai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, the gurmukhs enjoy the delight of love and liberate themselves from all the bondages.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu guris`K vMsu DMnu gurmiq iniD KtY ]23]27]
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Dhannu Gurasikh Vansu Hai Dhannu Guramati Nidhi Khatai ?23?27?sataaee?

Shabad OS B.translation: The family lineage of theGuru and the Sikhs is blessed who following the wisdom of Guru realize the self.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir isMbl sPl Bey gurmiq siq kir bwNs mY sugMD hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Sinbal Sadhal Bhaay , Gurmati Sati Kari Baans Mai Sougandh Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who sincerely and faithfully follow the teachings of the True Guru turn into a fruit-bearing tree from a silk cotton tree (Simbal). That is to say that they become worthy from what good for nothing they were earlier. It is like egoistic bamboo tree

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir kMcn Bey mnUr gurmiq siq kir prKq AMD hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Kanchan Bhaay Manoora , Gurmati Sati Kari Parakhat Andh Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who toil their lives on the teachings of Guru become glittering like gold (those who are highly noble and pious) from burnt out iron sludge (useless persons). The ignorants acquire assayer intellect and become knowledgeable.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir kwlkUt AMmiRq huie kwl mY Akwl Bey AsiQr kMD hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Kaalakoot Anmrit Hui , Kaal Mai Akaal Bhaay Asadir Kandh Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who imbibe Guru's teachings as true are filled with spiritual happiness shedding all the attachment with maya. They do not fear death any more and their body rests in the memory of the Lord forever.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq siq kir jIvn mukq Bey mwieAw mY audws bws bMD inrbMD hY ]27]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmati Sati Kari Jeevan Moukat Bhaay , Maaiaa Mai Udaas Baas Bandh Nirabandh Hai ?27?

Shabad OS B.translation: such people are emancipated from the love and attachment of worldly pleasures despite staying and living their life-span in this world. (27)
